[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ fullwidth=”on” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ height=”731px” custom_margin=”||-260px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” hover_enabled=”0″ fb_built=”1″ _i=”0″ _address=”0″][et_pb_fullwidth_image _builder_version=”3.29.3″ hover_enabled=”0″ _i=”0″ _address=”0.0″ src=”https://aiopestcontrol.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/WILDLIFE-3.png” height=”1000px”][/et_pb_fullwidth_image][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ fb_built=”1″ _i=”1″ _address=”1″][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”1.0″][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”1.0.0″][et_pb_accordion _builder_version=”3.29.3″ toggle_level=”h2″ toggle_font_size=”17px” text_shadow_style=”preset2″ text_shadow_vertical_length=”0.22em” _i=”0″ _address=”1.0.0.0″][et_pb_accordion_item open=”on” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ body_font_size=”55px” _i=”0″ _address=”1.0.0.0.0″]

Safeguard Your Home From Wildlife With All In One Pest Control

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ fb_built=”1″ _i=”2″ _address=”2″][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.0″][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.0.0″][et_pb_accordion _builder_version=”3.29.3″ custom_margin=”-300px||||false|false” _i=”0″ _address=”2.0.0.0″][et_pb_accordion_item open=”on” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.0.0.0.0″]

All in one pest control is a professional and humane wildlife removal company specializing in removing various animals from homes and businesses. Our team of experts is trained to handle all types of wildlife invasions, from raccoons and skunks and bats. We use professional techniques to remove animals and prevent future re-entry, ensuring the safety and well-being of both the animals and our customers. Contact us today to solve your wildlife problem and enjoy a pest-free environment.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”1″ _address=”2.1″][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.1.0″][et_pb_accordion _builder_version=”3.29.3″ custom_margin=”-147px||||false|false” _i=”0″ _address=”2.1.0.0″][et_pb_accordion_item open=”on” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.1.0.0.0″]

Most homeowners hope they’ll never need to call a wildlife control. However, when wildlife such as raccoons take up residence in your attic or bats turn your belfry into their home, it can become a significant source of stress.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”2″ _address=”2.2″][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.2.0″][et_pb_accordion _builder_version=”3.29.3″ custom_margin=”-72px||||false|false” _i=”0″ _address=”2.2.0.0″][et_pb_accordion_item open=”on” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”2.2.0.0.0″]

Selecting the appropriate wildlife control service can be overwhelming. At All in one  pest Control, we aim to inform homeowners about our humane and effective process for removing and preventing wildlife from entering your property. When you opt for our services, you can be confident in a team that is not only highly trained but also treats your home with the utmost care and respect it deserves.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ custom_margin=”-158px||||false|false” fb_built=”1″ _i=”3″ _address=”3″][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”3.0″][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”3.0.0″][et_pb_image src=”https://aiopestcontrol.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/pexels-photo-987954.jpeg” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”3.0.0.0″][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”1″ _address=”3.0.0.1″]

A raccoon’s face has several markings that help it stand out. The most noticeable marking is the black “mask”—large black markings around each eye. They extend from the edge of the nose to the lower part of the cheek. In addition, raccoons have whitish patches on top of the eyes and around the nose. Raccoons have grayish-brown fur over most of their body, and their tails have four to six black rings.

Raccoons are omnivores, meaning they will eat both meat and vegetables. They like grasshoppers, nuts, berries, mice, squirrels, and bird eggs. They are nocturnal and search for food at night. Raccoons are opportunistic feeders and are well known by people for their skillful attempts at stealing food from garbage cans in parks and neighborhoods. Raccoons are able to get food that other animals cannot because they have nimble, almost handlike paws that can grasp at tree branches, nuts, fruits, and even the lids of garbage cans.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”1″ _address=”3.0.1″][et_pb_image src=”https://aiopestcontrol.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/pexels-photo-12019751.jpeg” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ height=”447px” _i=”0″ _address=”3.0.1.0″][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”2″ _address=”3.0.2″][et_pb_image src=”https://aiopestcontrol.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/skunk-wildlife-portrait-walking-preview.jpg” _builder_version=”3.29.3″ height=”455px” max_height=”473px” _i=”0″ _address=”3.0.2.0″][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ fb_built=”1″ _i=”4″ _address=”4″][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”4.0″][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”4.0.0″][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”1″ _address=”4.0.1″][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”4.0.1.0″]

Bats are the only mammals that can fly. Instead of arms or hands, they have wings. The wings have a bone structure similar to the human hand. Between the bones are flaps of skin. Bats are very light weight to make it easier for them to fly. The western pipistrelle bat weighs less than a penny, while the greater mastiff bat weighs about two ounces (57 grams).

 They hunt at night and eat flying insects such as mosquitoes, beetles, and moths, many of which are considered pests. Bats provide an important ecological service by eating tons of insects. Not all bats eat insects. Some live on a diet of nectar and fruit. Bats that feed on nectar also serve as pollinators to nighttime blooming plants.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”2″ _address=”4.0.2″][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”0″ _address=”4.0.2.0″]

Skunks are mammals in the family Mephitidae. They are known for their ability to spray a liquid with a strong, unpleasant scent from their anal glands. Different species of skunk vary in appearance from black-and-white to brown, cream or ginger colored, but all have warning coloration.

Skunks are omnivorous, eating both plant and animal material and changing their diets as the seasons change. They eat insects, larvae, earthworms, grubs, rodents, lizards, salamanders, frogs, snakes, birds, moles, and eggs. They also commonly eat berries, roots, leaves, grasses, fungi and nuts.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_accordion _builder_version=”3.29.3″ _i=”1″ _address=”4.0.2.1″][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”3.29.3″ custom_margin=”-204px||||false|false” custom_padding=”28px||||false|false” fb_built=”1″ _i=”5″ _address=”5″][/et_pb_section]
